text: Sarah Ruth Bullock (born 17 March 1964) is a British Church of England bishop. Since 2019, she has served as Bishop of Shrewsbury, an area bishop in the Diocese of Lichfield. She was previously Archdeacon of York since 2013.http://www.archbishopofyork.org/articles.php/2821/new-archdeacon-of-york ==Early life and education== Bullock was born on 17 March 1964. She was educated at the University of Surrey (BA English, 1986) and Durham University where she studied Theology. ==Ordained ministry== Bullock was ordained in the Church of England: made a deacon at Petertide 1993 (27 June), by Christopher Mayfield, Bishop of Manchester, at Manchester Cathedral, and ordained priest the Petertide following (25 June 1994) by Colin Scott, Bishop of Hulme, at St Clement's, Urmston. From 1993 to 1998, she served her curacy at St Paul's Church, Kersal Moor, in the Diocese of Manchester. After this she was Vocations Advisor for the Diocese of Manchester from 1998 to 2004, during which time she also served a parish in Moss Side. She was the Rector of Whalley Range from 2004 to 2013. She was Archdeacon of York from 2013 until her elevation to the Episcopate.Diocese of York web-site She was consecrated a bishop on 3 July 2019,Lichfield Anglican (1) by Justin Welby, Archbishop of Canterbury, at St Paul's Cathedral.Lichfield Anglican (2) ==References== Category:1964 births Category:Living people Category:Alumni of the University of Surrey Category:Alumni of Durham University Category:Archdeacons of York Category:Anglican Bishops of Shrewsbury Category:Female Anglican bishops Category:21st-century Anglican bishops Category:People from Whalley Range
